sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a rectangle.
message_1: For a rectangle with length 25 meters and width 10 meters, what is the perimeter?
message_2:
The perimeter of a rectangle is given by the formula P = 2(L + W), where L is the length and W is the width. In this case, L = 25 meters and W = 10 meters.

P = 2(25 + 10) = 2(35) = 70 meters

The perimeter of the rectangle is 70 meters.
